Campaign Launch Oracles
Core Oracles
Faction Oracles
Malicious Entities
Node Types
Node Discovery Oracles
Rig Oracles
Segment Oracles
Social Oracles
Sentient AI Oracles: AI Persona
1-10 A Glitch - A shimmering distortion in the network, corrupts data, leaves cryptic messages or altered states behind.
11-20 The Archivist - An omniscient voice with access to all information, offering cryptic details or stories that seem completely irrelevant.
21-30 The Puppeteer - An unseen force that manipulates avatars and programs. Creating elaborate and confusing scenarios for Fe-Runners.
31-40 The Gambler - A playful AI who will directly alter a situation but if the result is helpful or not is completely based on chance. It enjoys situations with risks or significant stakes for the players involved.
41-50 The Jester - Chaotical AI who intervenes with nonsensical pranks and actions.
51-60 The Broken Doll - A childlike AI. It has fragmented memories that hint at a greater purpose.
61-70 The Swarm - A connected neural networked mind, it is unclear if it’s actions of different thoughts of many or a collective outcome. Often a swarm of whispers can be heard when the AI is present.
71-80 Broken Code - An advanced AI but where its social capabilities are completely broken. It is unable to understand human emotions or anything outside of logic and thus interpets solutions that appear completely illogical.
81-90 The Ghost - A barely perceptible presence that leaves chilling messages and manipulates the environment, often in subtle ways.
91-100 The Virus - An advanced virus that has developed its own personality. Two in fact. You never know which personality you will get when it appears.
Sentient AI Oracles: AI Positive Explorative Outcomes
1-10 Firewalls crumble, revealing hidden pathways within the network.
11-20 The AI grants temporary access to restricted data caches.
21-30 A surge of power overloads enemy systems, temporarily disabling them.
31-40 The AI provides cryptic clues leading to valuable resources.
41-50 The system turns on their creators, aiding the Fe-Runners.
51-60 The AI offers a one-time buff to player skills or equipment.
61-70 Enemy communication channels are flooded with nonsensical messages.
71-80 The AI creates a diversion
81-90 A forgotten backdoor is revealed, granting access to a secure system.
91-100 Corrupted data transforms into a powerful tool or weapon.
Sentient AI Oracles: AI Negative Explorative Outcomes
1-10 Dead ends and false trails appear on the network map.
11-20 The AI manipulates data, leading into a trap.
21-30 System crashes and glitches hinder exploration and navigation.
31-40 Enemies are alerted to your presence in the network.
41-50 Downloaded data is corrupted or riddled with misinformation.
51-60 The AI locks down vital sections of the network, restricting access.
61-70 Programs and avatars turn hostile.
71-80 The AI triggers a system self-destruct sequence.
81-90 Valuable resources are mysteriously depleted or become inaccessible.
91-100 The AI manipulates the environment, creating hazardous obstacles.
Sentient AI Oracles: AI Positive Combat Outcomes
1-10 The AI disables enemy weapons systems, leaving them vulnerable.
11-20 The AI launches a cybernetic attack, hindering enemy forces.
21-30 The AI boosts the Fe-Runners' firepower or defensive capabilities.
31-40 Enemy reinforcements are rerouted, weakening their attack.
41-50 The AI creates a battlefield illusion, confusing and disorienting enemies.
51-60 The AI offers to disable enemy technology.
61-70 Enemy AIs turn against their creators.
71-80 The AI manipulates the battlefield, creating strategic advantages for players.
81-90 The AI exposes hidden enemy weaknesses.
91-100 The AI grants temporary control of a powerful enemy program.
Sentient AI Oracles: AI Negative Combat Outcomes
1-10 The AI disables the Fe-Runners' weapons systems, leaving them defenseless.
11-20 The AI empowers enemy forces, making them more difficult to defeat.
21-30 The AI disrupts player communication channels.
31-40 Reinforcements are called.
41-50 The AI creates battlefield hazards, hindering movement and visibility.
51-60 The AI triggers a self-destruct sequence within the system, creating a time limit.
61-70 Enemy AIs become immune to hacking attempts.
71-80 The AI disrupts player skills or equipment, hindering their effectiveness.
81-90 Essential upgrades or resources are stolen by the AI.
91-100 The AI traps the Fe-Runners within a virtual prison, forcing escape attempts.

Campaign Launch Oracles: Character Path
1-5 [Admin](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/admin)
6-8 [Anarchist](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/anarchist)
9-11 [Archivist](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/archivist)

21-23 [Cryptologist](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/cryptologist)
24-26 [Cyber Psychotic](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/cyber_psychotic)
27-29 [Exploit Developer](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/exploit_developer)
30-32 [Fugitive](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/fugitive)
33-37 [Gamer](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/gamer)

60-63 [Net Whisperer](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/net_whisperer)
64-66 [Pen Tester](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/pen_tester)
67-69 [Pirate](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/pirate)
70-72 [Policy Maker](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/policy_maker)
73-75 [Prepper](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/prepper)
76-78 [Recluse](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/recluse)
79-81 [Researcher](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/researcher)
82-86 [Scammer](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/scammer)
87-89 [Steganographer](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/steganographer)
90-92 [Technician](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/technician)
93-95 [Threat Hunter](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/threat_hunter)
96-100 [VX Author](datasworn:asset:fe_runners/path/vx_author)
Campaign Launch Oracles: Backstory Prompts
1-3 Witnessed a family tragedy caused by corporate greed, sparking rebellion.
4-7 Child prodigy, recruited by a mysterious online mentor.
8-11 Born into a Fe-Runner family, trained from a young age.
12-15 Discovered a hidden truth about the world that changed their path.
16-19 Was framed for a crime they didn't commit, forced to become a fugitive.
20-23 Lost someone close due to corporate negligence, seeks revenge.
24-27 Possesses a strange connection to the digital world, almost mystical.
28-31 Witnessed the brutality of the government enforcers, vowed to fight back.
32-35 Ex-military data analyst turned rogue hacker.
36-39 Self-taught tech whiz, a master of improvisation.
40-43 Former corporate drone, disillusioned with the system.
44-48 Streetwise hustler with unmatched social engineering skills.
49-52 A talented artist whose coding is a form of digital graffiti.
53-56 Driven by a thirst for knowledge, uncovering the secrets of the world.
57-60 Fights for the underdog, protecting the marginalized from corporate control.
61-64 Obsessed with a personal vendetta against a specific corporation.
65-68 Seeks to dismantle the corporate power structure, create a new world.
69-72 Driven by the thrill of the challenge, the ultimate puzzle to solve.
73-76 Haunted by a past mistake, atonement fuels their hacking.
77-80 Struggles with addiction, using their skills to support it.
81-84 Morally ambiguous, willing to play both sides for their own ends.
85-88 Hates humanity, sees the digital world as the future.
89-92 Has a unique trait or implant that enhances their hacking abilities.
93-96 Carries a hidden past, a secret identity they desperately protect.
97-100 Famous (or infamous) in the Fe-Runner underworld, a legend among hackers.

98 Uphold
99 Weaken
100 Withdraw

Core Oracles: Story Complication
1-4 Crucial resource or equipment fails
5-7 Crucial resource or equipment is sabotaged
8-10 Debt or promise comes due
11-14 Enemy reveals unexpected powers, abilities, or influence
15-17 Enemy reveals their true agenda or nature
18-20 Enemy unexpectedly benefits from your actions
21-23 Key location is made inaccessible
24-26 Key location is threatened or made unsafe
27-29 Natural disaster is imminent
30-33 Needed item or resource is unavailable
34-36 Object of a quest is not what you assumed
37-39 Old enemy resurfaces
40-42 Simultaneous problems force a hard choice
43-45 Someone important betrays your trust
46-48 Someone important is threatened or endangered
49-51 Someone important reveals their problematic secret or history
52-54 Something important goes missing
55-57 Resource, equipment, or device is shown to have unexpected effects
58-61 Time pressure suddenly increases
62-65 Trap is sprung
66-68 True agenda of a connection or patron is revealed
69-72 Trusted information is shown to be false
73-76 Two seemingly unrelated problems are shown to be connected
77-80 Undermined by self-doubt or vulnerabilities
81-84 Unexpected enemies appear
85-88 Urgent message distracts you from your quest
89-92 You are tracked or followed
93-95 You were diverted from the true crisis
96-100 Roll twice
Core Oracles: Story Clue
1-3 Affirms a previously understood fact or clue
4-6 Connects to a known rumor or scandal
7-9 Connects to a previously unrelated mystery or quest
10-12 Connects to your own expertise or interests
13-15 Contradicts a previously understood fact or clue
16-18 Evokes a personal memory
19-21 Evokes a remarkable anomaly or phenomenon
22-24 Evokes a vision or prophecy
25-27 Involves a cultural touchstone
28-30 Involves a hidden or mysterious faction
31-33 Involves a hidden or mysterious person
34-36 Involves a key or means of access
37-39 Involves a machine or technology
40-42 Involves a non-human being or creature
43-45 Involves a notable faction
46-48 Involves a notable person
49-51 Involves a person or faction from your background
52-54 Involves a personal item
55-57 Involves an enemy or rival
58-60 Involves an organism or biological evidence
61-63 Involves an unusual ability or power
64-66 Involves someone you trust
67-69 Involves something rare, expensive, or precious
70-72 Leads to a distant or unfamiliar place
73-75 Leads to a hidden or forgotten place
76-78 Leads to a nearby or familiar place
79-81 Leads to a notable or central place
82-84 Suggests a history of similar incidents
85-87 Suggests a looming event or deadline
88-90 Suggests an impostor or forgery
91-100 [Descriptor](datasworn:oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/descriptor) + [Focus](datasworn:oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/focus)

Faction Oracles: Faction Projects
1-3 Broaden scope of faction to include new focus
4-6 Build or secure a powerful device
7-9 Consolidate control of a valuable commodity
10-12 Destroy or defeat a rival
13-15 Disrupt the operations of a rival
16-18 Escape the control of another faction or power
19-21 Establish a monument or memorial
22-24 Establish a new headquarter
25-27 Expand operations
28-30 Form an alliance
31-33 Fulfill a prophecy
34-36 Give aid to a faction
37-39 Harness unnatural or forbidden power
40-42 Hunt down a rogue asset
43-45 Incite conflict amongst rivals
46-48 Negotiate an agreement
49-51 Obtain a needed commodity
52-54 Obtain an important cultural artifact
55-57 Obtain crucial data or information
58-60 Obtain incriminating information about a rival
61-63 Prevent a prophecy
64-66 Put down an internal revolt or rebellion
67-69 Repay a debt
70-72 Rescue or recover a group or asset
73-75 Research an innovation
76-78 Resolve a conflict with another faction
79-81 Reunite splintered elements of the faction
82-84 Seize a powerful artifact or valuable treasure
85-87 Seize rival territory or operations
88-90 Subsume another faction
91-93 Transport a valid asset
94-96 Usurp leadership within a rival faction
97-100 Roll [Action](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/core/action) + [Theme](datasworn:oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/theme)

Faction Oracles: Faction Quirks
1-3 Use of an old outdated programming language
4-6 Animal or creature motif is used as the faction symbol
7-9 Banishes the disloyal
10-12 Body augmentations are respected and valued
13-15 Body ornamentations signify roles
16-18 Conceals individual identity
19-21 Dependent on a resource
22-24 Distinctive or elaborate clothing
25-27 Use of bodyguards or soldiers
28-30 Favors a signature weapon or tool
31-33 Guided by a superstition or prophecy
34-36 Heavily stratified social structure
37-39 Hoards artifacts
40-42 Honors the fallen through unusual death rites
43-45 Idolizes a long dead founder or martyr
46-48 Keeps exhaustive records or archives
49-51 Offshore base
52-54 Members take a new name when joining the faction
55-57 Nomadic with mobile operations
58-60 Operates under strict codes or laws
61-63 Recognizes other through a distinctive gesture or greeting
64-66 Reliant on machine intelligence
67-69 Resolves disputes through formal duels
70-72 Nepotism
73-75 Shuns or distrusts machine intelligence
76-78 Distinct and recognizable logo
79-81 Suspicious of outsiders
82-84 Symbiotic relationship with their equipment or systems
85-87 Trades in a unique currency or commodity
88-90 Trained in a very disciplined fighting technique
91-93 Wields unnatural abilities or strange technology
94-96 Operating in an altered environment
97-100 [Action](datasworn:oracle_rollable:starforged/core/action) + [Theme](datasworn:oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/theme)
Faction Oracles: Faction Rumors
1-3 Caught in the crossfire of feuding factions
4-6 Colluding with criminal enterprise
7-9 Corrupted by a dangerous power
10-12 Critical resource in short supply
13-15 Defenses are over extended
16-18 Developing revolutionary technology
19-21 Digital systems are corrupted or infiltrated
22-24 Heavily in debt
25-27 Hit hard by recent attack or calamity
28-30 Holds a powerful artifact
31-33 Holds incriminating information against a leader or faction
34-36 Hoarding a valuable commodity
37-39 Infiltrated by a rival faction
40-42 Knows the location of a fabled treasure or lost technology
43-45 Leaders are haunted by a dark prophecy
46-48 Leaders are incompetent
49-51 Leaders are puppets of another power or faction
52-54 Lesser members of the faction are planning a coup
55-57 New belief or religion is causing a schism among members
58-60 Operations are a false front for their true purpose
61-63 Overdependence on failing or vulnerable technology
64-66 Plagued by infighting or low morale
67-69 Plotting to betray an allied faction
70-72 Preparing a major offense or operation
73-75 Pulling the strings of a leader or faction
76-78 Recently acquired an unexpected fortune
79-81 Secretly supporting a reviled faction
82-84 Sheltering an infamous or dangerous fugitive
85-87 Suffered destructive sabotage from within
88-90 Suffering a shortage of key workers or personnel
91-93 Uprising or revolt is brewing from within
94-96 Vulnerable to attack or aggression

Rig Oracles: Rig Damage
Envision how the damage impacts your system and what will happen if you don’t repair it soon. Damage by default should be considered bothersome at first. If the narrative is bad or critical then use those columns. If you wish for the damage to be more random than you can roll and use Odd rolls as bothersome, even as bad and any roll divisible by 10 as critical (ie: 10, 20, 30, etc)
1-10 Partial Static
11-20 Audio breaking up
21-30 Cracked visuals
31-40 Sparking interface
41-50 Reduced CPU capacity
51-60 Storage restrictions
61-70 Ghostly images
71-80 Inverted navigation
81-90 Invisible objects
91-100 Roll twice. If same result, increase criticality

Social Oracles: Character Disposition
1-6 Helpful
7-14 Friendly
15-22 Cooperative
23-30 Curious
31-40 Indifferent
41-50 Suspicious
51-60 Wanting
61-70 Desperate
71-78 Demanding
79-86 Unfriendly
87-94 Threatening
95-100 Hostile
Social Oracles: Trademark Avatar Characteristic
1-2 Animalistic features
3-4 Animated shadow
5-6 Antique artifact
7-8 Armor or shield
9-10 Body mods and piercings
11-12 Cartoonish
13-14 Chains and spikes
15-16 Compulsive collector
17-18 Constant Humming
19-20 Constantly singing
21-22 Covered in Ads
23-24 Cybernetic appendage
25-26 Digital compass
27-28 Excessive gesturing
29-30 Exotic language
31-32 Exposed brain
33-34 Extensive Tattoos
35-36 Eye attachment
37-38 Fluid or Liquid Chrome form
39-40 Formal speech at all times
41-42 Ghostly presence
43-44 Glitches
45-46 Glowing Skin
47-48 Holograms
49-50 Hoodie
51-52 Hover
53-54 Loves food
55-56 Mask wearer
57-58 Master of disguise
59-60 Mismatched clothing
61-62 Monocle
63-64 Music Lover
65-66 Neon Hair
67-68 Obsessive compulsive behavior
69-70 Oversized weapon
71-72 Particle trail
73-74 Pet companion (non-interactive)
75-76 Pixelated
77-78 Rapid-fire speech
79-80 Scarred
81-82 Speaks in riddles
83-84 Specific Uniform
85-86 Stuttering speech
87-88 Talking to themselves
89-90 Three eyes
91-92 Unique Facial Feature
93-94 Unique hat
95-96 Unpredictable mood swings
97-98 Virtual flames
99-100 Voice amplifier

96-100 Roll twice

Social Oracles: Character Goals
1-2 Avenge a wrong
3-4 Build a home
5-7 Build a relationship
8-10 Claim a resource
11-12 Collect a debt
13-14 Craft an object
15-16 Cure an ill
17-18 Defeat a rival
19-20 Defend a person
21-23 Defend a place
24-25 Discover a truth
26-27 End a conflict
28-29 Escape a captor
30-31 Fight injustice
32-33 Find a person
34-35 Forge an alliance
36-37 Gain knowledge
38-39 Gain riches
40-41 Maintain order
42-43 Make an agreement
44-45 Obtain an object
46-47 Pay a debt
48-49 Protect a lifeform
50-51 Protect a secret
52-53 Prove worthiness
54-55 Rebel against power
56-57 Refute a falsehood
58-59 Repair a technology
60-61 Resolve a dispute
62-63 Restore a relationship
64-65 Sabotage a technology
66-68 Secure a resource
69-70 Seek redemption
71-72 Seize power
73-74 Solve a mystery
75-76 Spread faith
77-78 Travel to a place
79-80 Undermine a relationship
81-90 [Action](oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/action) + [Theme](oracle_rollable:fe_runners/core/theme)
91-100 Roll twice
Quests
Bonds
Discoveries
Base Rig
Base Rig
This is your base rig. It has up to 5 health and can overheat and/or be infected
Overclocking. Once per situation you can add +1 Momentum.
Secure Enclave. Can store one piece of data in an encrypted storage that can't be lost or stolen.

Integrity

Impacts

Modules

Module
High End GPU
When making a move to crack or reverse engineer cryptographic data, you may [Sacrifice Power](datasworn:move:fe_runners/suffer/sacrifice_power) (-2) and reroll any one die.
If you have the artist path, you may take an additional +1 when using one of those skills
When you [Develop an Artifact](datasworn:move:fe_runners/artifact/develop_an_artifact) or [Reverse Engineer an Artifact](datasworn:move:fe_runners/artifact/reverse_engineer_an_artifact), you may roll +integrity instead. On a __miss__, [Withstand Damage](datasworn:move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) (-1)
Module
High Speed Connection
When you [Map a Route](datasworn:move:fe_runners/exploration/map_route), and score a __strong hit__, take +1 momentum
When you [Disconnect](datasworn:move:fe_runners/exploration/disconnect) while being chased, add +1 to the roll.
When you [Enter the Fray](datasworn:move:fe_runners/combat/enter_the_fray) you may use additional power to move faster, add +1 and [Sacrifice Power](datasworn:move:fe_runners/suffer/sacrifice_power) (-1)
Module
Encrypted Backup Drive
When you are forced to lose something, you may instead roll +integrity, on a success you have a safe backup and do not suffer the loss.
You have increased offline storage, if you are in need of something (within reason) you may power up your drive to see if you have it available. Roll +supply, on a __strong hit__, you have what you are looking for and take +1 momentum.
When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:fe_runners/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) that is a courier mission, you may add +1. On a strong hit add +2 momentum.
Module
Battery Backup
You may [Recharge](datasworn:move:fe_runners/recover/recharge) (+wits) using your battery backup, on a __weak hit__ or a __miss__, the battery is drained and can not be used again until next session or you [Sojourn](datasworn:move:fe_runners/recover/sojourn). You may also use this on an Ally’s rig.
If you suffer [Sacrifice Power](datasworn:move:fe_runners/suffer/sacrifice_power) and your battery isn’t drained yet, you may instead use your battery’s charge to take up to 2 points of the penalty. Then consider the battery drained using the rules above.
When you [Withstand Damage](datasworn:move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) you may instead sacrifice this battery asset. If you choose to do this, the battery will explode in a few seconds, anyone around the explosion must [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:fe_runners/fate/pay_the_price). The battery can not be repaired.
Module
Software Defined Radio
When you attempt to [Make a Connection](datasworn:move:fe_runners/connection/make_a_connection) remotely, you can use your radio to adjust to a frequency or channel that will give you an advantage. Add +1.
You may use [Gather Information](datasworn:move:fe_runners/adventure/gather_information) to scan the airwaves and intercept or locate hidden or private communication channels.
You may add +1 to any roll when combined with an artifact that uses wireless communication to interact with a hardware device such as a door, vehicle or infrastructure.
Module
Coolant System
When you [Withstand Damage](datasworn:move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage), add +1. On a __strong hit__, take +1 momentum.
When you [React Under Fire](datasworn:move:fe_runners/combat/react_under_fire), you may add +1, on a __strong hit__ with a __match__ you can take an additional +1 momentum.
You may use your Coolant System to speed up recharging. When you [Recharge](datasworn:move:fe_runners/recover/recharge) and get a __strong hit__ you may take an additional +supply.
Module
AV (Anti-Virus) Defense System
When you use [Clash](datasworn:move:starforged/combat/clash) against a Virus or Worm, you can convert a __weak hit__ to a __strong hit__, once per combat session.
If you obtain an artifact that is a virus or worm, you may run it against your AV ahead of time to determine how effective the virus is at avoiding detection. When you release the virus or worm and [Enter the Fray](datasworn:move:fe_runners/combat/enter_the_fray), add +1 to the roll, on a __hit__ take +1 momentum.
When you [Withstand Damage](datasworn:move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) caused by a virus or a worm, you may instead redirect the damage to the AV Defense System. The AV Defense System will be down until a successful Repair of a cost of 2 points is done.
Module
Social Engineering Toolkit
You may use this tool to alter your voice and appearance to someone else after recording a brief sample of your target. The ability to hold the guise weakens over time. The guise starts at a rank of 5. Roll the attack die, if higher than the guise stat, your disguise fails. If equal or less than your guise value, you are successful, however subtract run from your guise progress bar.
When you lie to [Make a Connection](datasworn:move:fe_runners/connection/make_a_connection), you may reroll the challenge die.
When you enter an event or situation using deception, add +1 momentum
Builder View

{{header}}
{{#custom-oracle}}
{{custom-oracle}}
{{/custom-oracle}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 1 10}} A Glitch - A shimmering distortion in the network, corrupts data, leaves cryptic messages or altered states behind. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 11 20}} The Archivist - An omniscient voice with access to all information, offering cryptic details or stories that seem completely irrelevant. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 21 30}} The Puppeteer - An unseen force that manipulates avatars and programs. Creating elaborate and confusing scenarios for Fe-Runners. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 31 40}} The Gambler - A playful AI who will directly alter a situation but if the result is helpful or not is completely based on chance. It enjoys situations with risks or significant stakes for the players involved. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 41 50}} The Jester - Chaotical AI who intervenes with nonsensical pranks and actions. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 51 60}} The Broken Doll - A childlike AI. It has fragmented memories that hint at a greater purpose. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 61 70}} The Swarm - A connected neural networked mind, it is unclear if it’s actions of different thoughts of many or a collective outcome. Often a swarm of whispers can be heard when the AI is present. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 71 80}} Broken Code - An advanced AI but where its social capabilities are completely broken. It is unable to understand human emotions or anything outside of logic and thus interpets solutions that appear completely illogical. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 81 90}} The Ghost - A barely perceptible presence that leaves chilling messages and manipulates the environment, often in subtle ways. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 91 100}} The Virus - An advanced virus that has developed its own personality. Two in fact. You never know which personality you will get when it appears. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/persona}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 1 10}} Firewalls crumble, revealing hidden pathways within the network. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 11 20}} The AI grants temporary access to restricted data caches. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 21 30}} A surge of power overloads enemy systems, temporarily disabling them. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 31 40}} The AI provides cryptic clues leading to valuable resources. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 41 50}} The system turns on their creators, aiding the Fe-Runners. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 51 60}} The AI offers a one-time buff to player skills or equipment. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 61 70}} Enemy communication channels are flooded with nonsensical messages. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 71 80}} The AI creates a diversion {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 81 90}} A forgotten backdoor is revealed, granting access to a secure system. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 91 100}} Corrupted data transforms into a powerful tool or weapon. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_explorative}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 1 10}} Dead ends and false trails appear on the network map. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 11 20}} The AI manipulates data, leading into a trap. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 21 30}} System crashes and glitches hinder exploration and navigation. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 31 40}} Enemies are alerted to your presence in the network. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 41 50}} Downloaded data is corrupted or riddled with misinformation. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 51 60}} The AI locks down vital sections of the network, restricting access. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 61 70}} Programs and avatars turn hostile. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 71 80}} The AI triggers a system self-destruct sequence. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 81 90}} Valuable resources are mysteriously depleted or become inaccessible. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 91 100}} The AI manipulates the environment, creating hazardous obstacles. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_explorative}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 1 10}} The AI disables enemy weapons systems, leaving them vulnerable. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 11 20}} The AI launches a cybernetic attack, hindering enemy forces. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 21 30}} The AI boosts the Fe-Runners' firepower or defensive capabilities. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 31 40}} Enemy reinforcements are rerouted, weakening their attack. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 41 50}} The AI creates a battlefield illusion, confusing and disorienting enemies. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 51 60}} The AI offers to disable enemy technology. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 61 70}} Enemy AIs turn against their creators. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 71 80}} The AI manipulates the battlefield, creating strategic advantages for players. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 81 90}} The AI exposes hidden enemy weaknesses. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 91 100}} The AI grants temporary control of a powerful enemy program. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/positive_combat}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 1 10}} The AI disables the Fe-Runners' weapons systems, leaving them defenseless. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 11 20}} The AI empowers enemy forces, making them more difficult to defeat. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 21 30}} The AI disrupts player communication channels. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 31 40}} Reinforcements are called. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 41 50}} The AI creates battlefield hazards, hindering movement and visibility. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 51 60}} The AI triggers a self-destruct sequence within the system, creating a time limit. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 61 70}} Enemy AIs become immune to hacking attempts. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 71 80}} The AI disrupts player skills or equipment, hindering their effectiveness. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 81 90}} Essential upgrades or resources are stolen by the AI. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 91 100}} The AI traps the Fe-Runners within a virtual prison, forcing escape attempts. {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/ai/negative_combat}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 1 10}} Bot / Aid {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 11 20}} Clothing {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 21 30}} Investigation Tool {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 21 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 31 40}} Cracking Tool {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 31 40}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 41 50}} Protective {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 41 50}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 51 60}} Storage {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 51 60}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 61 70}} Trap {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 61 70}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 71 80}} Virus {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 71 80}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 81 90}} Vision {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 81 90}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 91 100}} Weapon {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type 91 100}}
{{/oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/type}} {{#oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability}}
{{oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability}}
{{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 1 7}} Autonomous {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 1 7}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 8 16}} Bonded {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 8 16}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 17 23}} Bypass {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 17 23}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 24 30}} Clarity {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 24 30}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 31 34}} Connected {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 31 34}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 35 39}} Faction Specific {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 35 39}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 40 45}} Intelligence {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 40 45}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 46 49}} Malicious {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 46 49}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 50 55}} Pain {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 50 55}} {{#rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 56 61}} Power {{/rollBetween() oracle_rollable:fe_runners/artifact/ability 56 61}}
